result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derwin J. Petonquot

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Cheree
Cases 14CM1936 and 15CM390 called: 8:25am
State appears by ADA S.Brubacher.  Def appears in person and with Atty Rick Cveykus.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed; VRCW

State moves to:
15CM390>>D&RI entire file
14CM1936 - Ct. 1 (OWI 2nd/Repeater)>>AMEND to DELETE the Repeater allegation.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
14CM1936 - Ct. 1 (OWI 2nd)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis & def guilty

COURT ORDERS: $1530 inclusive to be paid today; 30 days MCJ w/huber for work and treatment if defendant qualifies under jail classification system, W/credit for 23 days of time already served, to begin within 45 days; 13 month DL Rev w/credit; AODA and any follow up recommended; Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant himself, both for a period of 13 months; IID to be installed within 14 days; $50 IID surcharge to be paid.

Adj: 8:35am

Status conference on March 9, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on April 16, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 29, 2015 at 09:15 am.

No contact with victim(s):  C.O.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings.    Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.    No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.  No alcohol.
